column1: Smoque BBQ////Every last morsel was divine. The pulled pork was moist yet surprisingly lean
column2: without an atom of gristle to be found. The ribs had the telltale pink ring of meat just beneath the surface that signifies an expertly-smoked rack. The texas sausage was tender and spicy. And then there's the brisket. I apologize if you have a Jewish grandmother
column3: because this is better than hers. It is perfectly seasoned and smoked to perfection
column4: tender while still retaining its meatiness and shape. The side dishes (fries
column8: corn bread) were all delectable; it was clear that effort had been put into them
column9: which is unusual for a barbecue place
